intro: Etlingera subviridis, commonly known as the green torch ginger, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and striking orange-red inflorescences. Its flowers are often used in traditional ceremonies and as ornamental plants due to their vibrant color. The rhizomes of Etlingera subviridis are also utilized in local cuisines and medicinal practices.
